article_title: New York City Catholics Brace for Fresh Wave of Parish Mergers
article_text:
As if on cue, the sun peeked over the neighboring high-rises just as Patricia Rodriguez rose from her park bench to read the Gospel.

Only four of the dozen regulars had gathered on this frigid day to celebrate an unofficial, open-air Roman Catholic service. Ms. Rodriguez, 51 years old and the unofficial leader of this group, was bundled head to toe and read quickly, bouncing up and down to keep warm. There were songs in English and Spanish, announcements and a free-flowing discussion of the liturgy. Instead of Holy...

twitter.description: As the Archdiocese of New York begins implementing the closures and mergers of some 100 parishes, it is wrestling with the challenge of persuading parishioners to not only give up a spiritual home—but to embrace a new one.
twitter.title: New York City Catholics Brace for Fresh Wave of Parish Mergers

image.alt: New York City Catholics brace for fresh wave of parish mergers

twitter.creator: @MelanieGWest
